When it comes to the future of our nation, we must ask ourselves: who are the true drivers of progress? The truth is, the older generation has had their time—decades of opportunities to build, to lead, and to shape our society. Now it’s time for the youth to take the reins. That means we must reallocate resources in a way that prioritizes the young and their potential.

First, consider the economic landscape. Older citizens, particularly those retired, are often drawing from public funds through pensions and healthcare systems. These are finite resources, and when we divert them to those who are no longer contributing to the labor force, we are essentially robbing the future from the hands of those who will build it. Young people today face a crisis of opportunity—rising costs of living, student debt, and a job market that’s been shaped by the decisions of the past. It’s only fair to shift support toward education, housing, and job creation for the young, not the elderly who have already reaped the benefits of their era.

Second, the younger generation is more adaptable, more innovative, and more in tune with the challenges of the 21st century. They are the ones who will solve the climate crisis, drive technological progress, and lead us into a new era of prosperity. Why should we continue to fund outdated systems that cater to a generation that is increasingly disconnected from the modern world? We must invest in the minds and bodies of our youth to ensure they can thrive, not be weighed down by the burdens of an aging population.

Third, from a demographic standpoint, the younger generation is the foundation of our future society. They are the ones who will pay taxes, serve in the military, and take care of our infrastructure. If we don’t invest in their well-being now, we risk a generation that is too burdened to take on these responsibilities. That’s not just unfair—it’s a threat to national stability.

We must be honest with ourselves: society is a zero-sum game when it comes to resources. If we continue to coddle an aging population, we are condemning our youth to a life of struggle. It’s time to be bold, to make tough choices, and to prioritize the people who will carry our nation forward. The time has come to let go of the past and build a future that belongs to the young.
